series.title: One Spirit, One Voice — Learning to Call on the Lord

lesson.title: The Mingled Spirit
lesson.summary: God made our spirit to receive His Spirit; we are vessels to contain God.

points.point: Our spirit is the inner receiver (like a radio) for God’s Spirit.
We are created in God’s image to contain His life and love.

lesson.practice: Hand on chest. Breathe. Say: “O Lord Jesus.”

lesson.title: Regenerated in Our Spirit
lesson.summary: Repent, believe, and call—God’s Spirit gives our spirit new life.

points.point: Two spirits: God’s Spirit + our spirit.
The Spirit witnesses we are God’s children.

lesson.title: The Lord Spirit: One Spirit with Us
lesson.summary: Jesus is the life-giving Spirit; in Him we are one spirit.

points.point: Confession removes the barrier so life flows again.
Call from deep inside to return to the spirit.

lesson.title: Calling on the Name of the Lord
lesson.summary: Calling out loud brings us into the spirit and marks God’s people.

points.point: From Enosh to the early church, believers called on the Lord.

lesson.title: Why We Call
lesson.summary: We call to be saved, rescued, filled with His riches, and receive the Spirit.

points.point: Calling stirs us when we feel low.

lesson.practice: “O Lord Jesus, You are good to me!”

lesson.title: Out of a Pure Heart—Daily, Together
lesson.summary: Call with a pure heart and lips—daily, lifelong, together—and drink the Spirit.

points.point: Saying “Jesus is Lord!” is drinking the Spirit.

lesson.practice: Short group calling, one verse, thanksgiving.
